verses.verse: Now the Philistines<WH6430> fought<WH3898> against Israel<WH3478>: and the men<WH376> of Israel<WH3478> fled<WH5127> from before<WH6440> the Philistines<WH6430>, and fell down<WH5307> slain<WH2491> in mount<WH2022> Gilboa<WH1533>.

And the Philistines<WH6430> followed hard<WH1692> after<WH310> Saul<WH7586> and after<WH310> his sons<WH1121>; and the Philistines<WH6430> slew<WH5221> Jonathan<WH3129>, and Abinadab<WH41>, and Malchi-shua<WH4444>, the sons<WH1121> of Saul<WH7586>.
And the battle<WH4421> went sore<WH3513> against Saul<WH7586>, and the archers<WH3384> overtook<WH4672> him<WH2342>; and he was distressed by reason of the archers<WH3384>.

Then said<WH559> Saul<WH7586> unto his armorbearer<WH5375>, Draw<WH8025> thy sword<WH2719>, and thrust<WH1856> me through therewith<WH6189>, lest these uncircumcised come<WH935> and abuse<WH5953> me<WH5375>. But his armorbearer would<WH14> not<WH3966>; for he was sore afraid<WH3372>. Therefore Saul<WH7586> took<WH3947> his sword<WH2719>, and fell upon it<WH5307>.
And when his armorbearer<WH5375> saw<WH7200> that Saul<WH7586> was dead<WH4191>, he likewise fell<WH5307> upon his sword<WH2719>, and died<WH4191>.
So Saul<WH7586> died<WH4191>, and his three<WH7969> sons<WH1121>; and all his house<WH1004> died<WH4191> together<WH3162>.

And when all the men<WH376> of Israel<WH3478> that were in the valley<WH6010> saw<WH7200> that they fled<WH5127>, and that Saul<WH7586> and his sons<WH1121> were dead<WH4191>, they forsook<WH5800> their cities<WH5892>, and fled<WH5127>; and the Philistines<WH6430> came<WH935> and dwelt in them<WH3427>.

And it came to pass on the morrow<WH4283>, when the Philistines<WH6430> came<WH935> to strip<WH6584> the slain<WH2491>, that they found<WH4672> Saul<WH7586> and his sons<WH1121> fallen<WH5307> in mount<WH2022> Gilboa<WH1533>.

And they stripped<WH6584> him<WH5375>, and took his head<WH7218>, and his armor<WH3627>, and sent<WH7971> into the land<WH776> of the Philistines<WH6430> round about<WH5439>, to carry the tidings<WH1319> unto their idols<WH6091>, and to the people<WH5971>.
And they put<WH7760> his armor<WH3627> in the house<WH1004> of their gods<WH430>, and fastened<WH8628> his head<WH1538> in the house<WH1004> of Dagon<WH1712>.
And when all Jabesh-gilead<WH3003> heard<WH8085> all that the Philistines<WH6430> had done<WH6213> to Saul<WH7586>,

all the valiant<WH2428> men<WH376> arose<WH6965>, and took away<WH5375> the body<WH1480> of Saul<WH7586>, and the bodies<WH1480> of his sons<WH1121>, and brought<WH935> them to Jabesh<WH3003>, and buried<WH6912> their bones<WH6106> under the oak<WH424> in Jabesh<WH3003>, and fasted<WH6684> seven<WH7651> days<WH3117>.

So Saul<WH7586> died<WH4191> for his trespass<WH4604> which he committed<WH4603> against Jehovah<WH3068>, because of the word<WH1697> of Jehovah<WH3068>, which he kept<WH8104> not<WH7592>; and also for that he asked counsel of one that had a familiar spirit<WH178>, to inquire thereby<WH1875>,
and inquired<WH1875> not of Jehovah<WH3068>: therefore he slew<WH4191> him<WH5437>, and turned the kingdom<WH4410> unto David<WH1732> the son<WH1121> of Jesse<WH3448>.
